sfnetworks 0.3.1

Reference

Construction

The core of the package is an sfnetwork data structure that can be provided directly to both graph analytical functions of tidygraph and spatial analytical functions of sf.

sfnetwork()

Create an sfnetwork object

as_sfnetwork()

Convert a foreign object to an sfnetwork object

is.sfnetwork()

Check if an object is an sfnetwork

Extensions

Some problems are so specific to spatial networks, that they can neither be solved by tidygraph nor sf. Therefore, sfnetworks contains several extensions to the current offer of the two “parent packages”.

st_shortest_paths() st_all_shortest_paths() st_network_distance()

Shortest paths between points in geographical space

edge_circuity() edge_length() edge_straight_length()

Querying spatial edge measures

to_spatial_coordinates() to_spatial_dense_graph() to_spatial_directed() to_spatial_explicit_edges() to_spatial_implicit_edges() to_spatial_shortest_paths() to_spatial_subgraph()

Spatial morphers for sfnetwork objects

Integration with sf

The sfnetworks package supports a wide range of sf functions to be directly applied to the network.

st_as_sf(<sfnetwork>) st_geometry(<sfnetwork>) `st_geometry<-`(<sfnetwork>) st_bbox(<sfnetwork>) st_coordinates(<sfnetwork>) st_is(<sfnetwork>) st_crs(<sfnetwork>) `st_crs<-`(<sfnetwork>) st_shift_longitude(<sfnetwork>) st_transform(<sfnetwork>) st_wrap_dateline(<sfnetwork>) st_zm(<sfnetwork>) st_m_range(<sfnetwork>) st_z_range(<sfnetwork>) st_agr(<sfnetwork>) `st_agr<-`(<sfnetwork>) st_intersects(<sfnetwork>) st_reverse(<sfnetwork>) st_simplify(<sfnetwork>) st_join(<sfnetwork>) st_crop(<sfnetwork>) st_filter(<sfnetwork>)

sf methods for sfnetwork objects

sf_attr() `sf_attr<-`()

Query sf attributes from the active element of an sfnetwork object

Integration with tidygraph

Since sfnetwork objects subclass tbl_graph objects, most tidygraph functions work automatically. However, some of them need a special method, mostly as a result of the presence of the sticky geometry list column in sfnetwork objects.

as_tbl_graph(<sfnetwork>) as_tibble(<sfnetwork>) morph(<sfnetwork>) mutate(<sfnetwork>) select(<sfnetwork>)

tidygraph methods for sfnetwork objects

Visualization

The sfnetworks package does not (yet?) include advanced visualization options. However, a simple plot method is provided, which gives a quick view of how the network looks like.

plot(<sfnetwork>)

Plot sfnetwork object

Test data

roxel

Road network of Münster Roxel
